bib.title: THE EVOLUTION OF THE INFORMATION RETRIEVAL LANGUAGES FOR XML
bib.author: KAZIENKO, Przemys{\l}aw and ZGRZYWA, Micha{\l}
bib.abstract: XML Path Language (XPath) is nowadays the most important language for information retrieval in XML documents and its main features were described in the paper. XPath is now widespread used eg in XML databases, XSL Transformations, XML Schema, XLink etc. Main disadvantages and restrictions of XPath were pointed. Additionally, SQL was compared with this language. Research on retrieval languages for XML are kept carrying out. The latest research results, incorporated into XPath 2.0 and XQuery 1.0, are: sequences, FLWOR
